Uses of Package
com.xuggle.xuggler

Packages that use com.xuggle.xuggler
com.xuggle.mediatool A simple API for to decoding, viewing and encoding media: tutorial here; start with ToolFactory. 
com.xuggle.mediatool.event Events that can be fired by the com.xuggle.mediatool package. 
com.xuggle.xuggler An advanced API for reading, decoding, re-sampling, encoding and writing of most media files. 
com.xuggle.xuggler.video A collection of utilities for working with Video in the Xuggle libraries. 
 

Classes in com.xuggle.xuggler used by com.xuggle.mediatool
IAudioSamples
          A set of raw (decoded) samples, plus a timestamp for when to play those samples relative to other items in a given IContainer.
IAudioSamples.Format
           
ICodec
          A "key" to an IStreamCoder that tells it how to encode or decode data.
ICodec.ID
           
ICodec.Type
           
IContainer
          A file (or network data source) that contains one or more IStream objects of audio and video data.
IError
          Maps from int return codes to defined Error values.
IPixelFormat.Type
           
IRational
          This class wraps represents a Rational number for the Xuggler.
IVideoPicture
          Represents one raw (undecoded) picture in a video stream, plus a timestamp for when to display that video picture relative to other items in a IContainer.
 

Classes in com.xuggle.xuggler used by com.xuggle.mediatool.event
IAudioSamples
          A set of raw (decoded) samples, plus a timestamp for when to play those samples relative to other items in a given IContainer.
IMediaData
          The parent class of all media objects than can be gotten from an IStream.
IPacket
          Represents an encoded piece of data that can be placed in an IContainer for a given IStream of data.
IVideoPicture
          Represents one raw (undecoded) picture in a video stream, plus a timestamp for when to display that video picture relative to other items in a IContainer.

IStreamCoder
          The work horse of the Xuggler: Takes IPacket data from an IContainer (representing an IStream) and an ICodec and allows you to decode or encode that data.
